TopicTitle: Am I the only "Glass half full" guy around here?

Articles.Content:
@Wallygator/RedIronCross: you can put mine right in the middle... maybe up a bit.... and to the right a tad bit...

there are good things to KSP and also bad things.

I love KSP for it's sheer stupidity and the fact it doesn't matter how creative you are your still going to freaking space in something you've built out of your hard earned time.

then there's the hate where the Devs have hit the wall with "new" ideas and are starting to put their own version of things which we have either seen or had in our games before because of mods.

not to say that's a bad thing but it's slightly upsetting to see these features come in and i'm just sitting here saying "oh that's another 4 mods i don't have to install."

but then again love comes back around and i can't help but get excited when something of mine barely survives re-entry because i managed to flip back around just in time to deploy my chute.

all in all. 50/50 right now. not too happy about the update but still happy it's 1.0 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

DO YOU KNOW WHAT THAT LEADS TO?!?" and nothing you do can please them. My guess is that over the years of developing this game, Squad has had to build some thick skin to deal with the abuse thrown at them. The fact of the matter is, developing any game this detailed is VERY hard. Don't believe me? Down load ANY game engine and develop one. Once you let the public know what you're doing, you'll have a whole mob of people criticizing what you're doing saying you're using the wrong engine or your code is messy and they can do it better. And some may be right. But, most are wrong. Felipe, you did a FANTASTIC job with a GIGANTIC project. Feel proud of your accomplishment and remember that your dream has finally come true after all these hard years of work. Congratulations! I raise my glass completely full of my homebrew wheat beer to you and your team. (sip) Now it's not so full anymore.
